00029 /* Example group ----------------------------------------------------------- */
00035 /************************** PRIVATE DEFINTIONS *************************/
00036 /* buffer size definition */
00037 #define UART_RING_BUFSIZE 256
00038 
00039 /* Buf mask */
00040 #define __BUF_MASK (UART_RING_BUFSIZE-1)
00041 /* Check buf is full or not */
00042 #define __BUF_IS_FULL(head, tail) ((tail&__BUF_MASK)==((head+1)&__BUF_MASK))
00043 /* Check buf will be full in next receiving or not */
00044 #define __BUF_WILL_FULL(head, tail) ((tail&__BUF_MASK)==((head+2)&__BUF_MASK))
00045 /* Check buf is empty */
00046 #define __BUF_IS_EMPTY(head, tail) ((head&__BUF_MASK)==(tail&__BUF_MASK))
00047 /* Reset buf */
00048 #define __BUF_RESET(bufidx)     (bufidx=0)
00049 #define __BUF_INCR(bufidx)      (bufidx=(bufidx+1)&__BUF_MASK)
00050 
00051 
00052 /************************** PRIVATE TYPES *************************/
00053 
00055 typedef struct
00056 {
00057     __IO uint32_t tx_head;                
00058     __IO uint32_t tx_tail;                
00059     __IO uint32_t rx_head;                
00060     __IO uint32_t rx_tail;                
00061     __IO uint8_t  tx[UART_RING_BUFSIZE];  
00062     __IO uint8_t  rx[UART_RING_BUFSIZE];  
00063 } UART_RING_BUFFER_T;

00067 uint8_t menu1[] = "Hello NXP Semiconductors \n\r";
00068 uint8_t menu2[] =
00069 "UART interrupt mode demo using ring buffer \n\r\t "
00070 "MCU LPC17xx - ARM Cortex-M3 \n\r\t "
00071 "UART0 - 9600bps \n\r";
00072 uint8_t menu3[] = "UART demo terminated!\n";

00075 UART_RING_BUFFER_T rb;
00076 
00077 // Current Tx Interrupt enable state
00078 __IO FlagStatus TxIntStat;

00092 /*----------------- INTERRUPT SERVICE ROUTINES --------------------------*/
00093 /*********************************************************************/
00098 void UART0_IRQHandler(void)
00099 {
00100         uint32_t intsrc, tmp, tmp1;
00101 
00102         /* Determine the interrupt source */
00103         intsrc = UART_GetIntId(LPC_UART0);
00104         tmp = intsrc & UART_IIR_INTID_MASK;
00105 
00106         // Receive Line Status
00107         if (tmp == UART_IIR_INTID_RLS){
00108                 // Check line status
00109                 tmp1 = UART_GetLineStatus(LPC_UART0);
00110                 // Mask out the Receive Ready and Transmit Holding empty status
00111                 tmp1 &= (UART_LSR_OE | UART_LSR_PE | UART_LSR_FE \
00112                                 | UART_LSR_BI | UART_LSR_RXFE);
00113                 // If any error exist
00114                 if (tmp1) {
00115                                 UART_IntErr(tmp1);
00116                 }
00117         }
00118 
00119         // Receive Data Available or Character time-out
00120         if ((tmp == UART_IIR_INTID_RDA) || (tmp == UART_IIR_INTID_CTI)){
00121                         UART_IntReceive();
00122         }
00123 
00124         // Transmit Holding Empty
00125         if (tmp == UART_IIR_INTID_THRE){
00126                         UART_IntTransmit();
00127         }
00128 
00129 }
00130 
00131 /********************************************************************/
00136 void UART_IntReceive(void)
00137 {
00138         uint8_t tmpc;
00139         uint32_t rLen;
00140 
00141         while(1){
00142                 // Call UART read function in UART driver
00143                 rLen = UART_Receive((LPC_UART_TypeDef *)LPC_UART0, &tmpc, 1, NONE_BLOCKING);
00144                 // If data received
00145                 if (rLen){
00146                         /* Check if buffer is more space
00147                          * If no more space, remaining character will be trimmed out
00148                          */
00149                         if (!__BUF_IS_FULL(rb.rx_head,rb.rx_tail)){
00150                                 rb.rx[rb.rx_head] = tmpc;
00151                                 __BUF_INCR(rb.rx_head);
00152                         }
00153                 }
00154                 // no more data
00155                 else {
00156                         break;
00157                 }
00158         }
00159 }
00160 
00161 /********************************************************************/
00166 void UART_IntTransmit(void)
00167 {
00168     // Disable THRE interrupt
00169     UART_IntConfig((LPC_UART_TypeDef *)LPC_UART0, UART_INTCFG_THRE, DISABLE);
00170 
00171         /* Wait for FIFO buffer empty, transfer UART_TX_FIFO_SIZE bytes
00172          * of data or break whenever ring buffers are empty */
00173         /* Wait until THR empty */
00174     while (UART_CheckBusy((LPC_UART_TypeDef *)LPC_UART0) == SET);
00175 
00176         while (!__BUF_IS_EMPTY(rb.tx_head,rb.tx_tail))
00177     {
00178         /* Move a piece of data into the transmit FIFO */
00179         if (UART_Send((LPC_UART_TypeDef *)LPC_UART0, (uint8_t *)&rb.tx[rb.tx_tail], 1, NONE_BLOCKING)){
00180         /* Update transmit ring FIFO tail pointer */
00181         __BUF_INCR(rb.tx_tail);
00182         } else {
00183                 break;
00184         }
00185     }
00186 
00187     /* If there is no more data to send, disable the transmit
00188        interrupt - else enable it or keep it enabled */
00189         if (__BUF_IS_EMPTY(rb.tx_head, rb.tx_tail)) {
00190         UART_IntConfig((LPC_UART_TypeDef *)LPC_UART0, UART_INTCFG_THRE, DISABLE);
00191         // Reset Tx Interrupt state
00192         TxIntStat = RESET;
00193     }
00194     else{
00195         // Set Tx Interrupt state
00196                 TxIntStat = SET;
00197         UART_IntConfig((LPC_UART_TypeDef *)LPC_UART0, UART_INTCFG_THRE, ENABLE);
00198     }
00199 }

00202 /*********************************************************************/
00207 void UART_IntErr(uint8_t bLSErrType)
00208 {
00209         uint8_t test;
00210         // Loop forever
00211         while (1){
00212                 // For testing purpose
00213                 test = bLSErrType;
00214         }
00215 }

00218 /*********************************************************************/
00226 uint32_t UARTSend(LPC_UART_TypeDef *UARTPort, uint8_t *txbuf, uint8_t buflen)
00227 {
00228     uint8_t *data = (uint8_t *) txbuf;
00229     uint32_t bytes = 0;
00230 
00231         /* Temporarily lock out UART transmit interrupts during this
00232            read so the UART transmit interrupt won't cause problems
00233            with the index values */
00234     UART_IntConfig(UARTPort, UART_INTCFG_THRE, DISABLE);
00235 
00236         /* Loop until transmit run buffer is full or until n_bytes
00237            expires */
00238         while ((buflen > 0) && (!__BUF_IS_FULL(rb.tx_head, rb.tx_tail)))
00239         {
00240                 /* Write data from buffer into ring buffer */
00241                 rb.tx[rb.tx_head] = *data;
00242                 data++;
00243 
00244                 /* Increment head pointer */
00245                 __BUF_INCR(rb.tx_head);
00246 
00247                 /* Increment data count and decrement buffer size count */
00248                 bytes++;
00249                 buflen--;
00250         }
00251 
00252         /*
00253          * Check if current Tx interrupt enable is reset,
00254          * that means the Tx interrupt must be re-enabled
00255          * due to call UART_IntTransmit() function to trigger
00256          * this interrupt type
00257          */
00258         if (TxIntStat == RESET) {
00259                 UART_IntTransmit();
00260         }
00261         /*
00262          * Otherwise, re-enables Tx Interrupt
00263          */
00264         else {
00265                 UART_IntConfig(UARTPort, UART_INTCFG_THRE, ENABLE);
00266         }
00267 
00268     return bytes;
00269 }
00270 
00271 
00272 /*********************************************************************/
00280 uint32_t UARTReceive(LPC_UART_TypeDef *UARTPort, uint8_t *rxbuf, uint8_t buflen)
00281 {
00282     uint8_t *data = (uint8_t *) rxbuf;
00283     uint32_t bytes = 0;
00284 
00285         /* Temporarily lock out UART receive interrupts during this
00286            read so the UART receive interrupt won't cause problems
00287            with the index values */
00288         UART_IntConfig(UARTPort, UART_INTCFG_RBR, DISABLE);
00289 
00290         /* Loop until receive buffer ring is empty or
00291                 until max_bytes expires */
00292         while ((buflen > 0) && (!(__BUF_IS_EMPTY(rb.rx_head, rb.rx_tail))))
00293         {
00294                 /* Read data from ring buffer into user buffer */
00295                 *data = rb.rx[rb.rx_tail];
00296                 data++;
00297 
00298                 /* Update tail pointer */
00299                 __BUF_INCR(rb.rx_tail);
00300 
00301                 /* Increment data count and decrement buffer size count */
00302                 bytes++;
00303                 buflen--;
00304         }
00305 
00306         /* Re-enable UART interrupts */
00307         UART_IntConfig(UARTPort, UART_INTCFG_RBR, ENABLE);
00308 
00309     return bytes;
00310 }
00311 
00312 /*********************************************************************/
00317 void print_menu(void)
00318 {
00319         uint32_t tmp, tmp2;
00320         uint8_t *pDat;
00321 
00322         tmp = sizeof(menu1);
00323         tmp2 = 0;
00324         pDat = (uint8_t *)&menu1[0];
00325         while(tmp) {
00326                 tmp2 = UARTSend((LPC_UART_TypeDef *)LPC_UART0, pDat, tmp);
00327                 pDat += tmp2;
00328                 tmp -= tmp2;
00329         }
00330 
00331         tmp = sizeof(menu2);
00332         tmp2 = 0;
00333         pDat = (uint8_t *)&menu2[0];
00334         while(tmp) {
00335                 tmp2 = UARTSend((LPC_UART_TypeDef *)LPC_UART0, pDat, tmp);
00336                 pDat += tmp2;
00337                 tmp -= tmp2;
00338         }
00339 }
00340 
00341 /*-------------------------MAIN FUNCTION------------------------------*/
00342 /*********************************************************************/
00347 int c_entry(void)
00348 {
00349         // UART Configuration structure variable
00350         UART_CFG_Type UARTConfigStruct;
00351         // UART FIFO configuration Struct variable
00352         UART_FIFO_CFG_Type UARTFIFOConfigStruct;
00353         // Pin configuration for UART0
00354         PINSEL_CFG_Type PinCfg;
00355 
00356         uint32_t idx, len;
00357         __IO FlagStatus exitflag;
00358         uint8_t buffer[10];
00359 
00360         /*
00361          * Initialize UART0 pin connect
00362          */
00363         PinCfg.Funcnum = 1;
00364         PinCfg.OpenDrain = 0;
00365         PinCfg.Pinmode = 0;
00366         PinCfg.Pinnum = 2;
00367         PinCfg.Portnum = 0;
00368         PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00369         PinCfg.Pinnum = 3;
00370         PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00371 
00372 
00373         /* Initialize UART Configuration parameter structure to default state:
00374          * Baudrate = 9600bps
00375          * 8 data bit
00376          * 1 Stop bit
00377          * None parity
00378          */
00379         UART_ConfigStructInit(&UARTConfigStruct);
00380 
00381         // Initialize UART0 peripheral with given to corresponding parameter
00382         UART_Init((LPC_UART_TypeDef *)LPC_UART0, &UARTConfigStruct);
00383 
00384 
00385         /* Initialize FIFOConfigStruct to default state:
00386          *                              - FIFO_DMAMode = DISABLE
00387          *                              - FIFO_Level = UART_FIFO_TRGLEV0
00388          *                              - FIFO_ResetRxBuf = ENABLE
00389          *                              - FIFO_ResetTxBuf = ENABLE
00390          *                              - FIFO_State = ENABLE
00391          */
00392         UART_FIFOConfigStructInit(&UARTFIFOConfigStruct);
00393 
00394         // Initialize FIFO for UART0 peripheral
00395         UART_FIFOConfig((LPC_UART_TypeDef *)LPC_UART0, &UARTFIFOConfigStruct);
00396 
00397 
00398         // Enable UART Transmit
00399         UART_TxCmd((LPC_UART_TypeDef *)LPC_UART0, ENABLE);
00400 
00401     /* Enable UART Rx interrupt */
00402         UART_IntConfig((LPC_UART_TypeDef *)LPC_UART0, UART_INTCFG_RBR, ENABLE);
00403         /* Enable UART line status interrupt */
00404         UART_IntConfig((LPC_UART_TypeDef *)LPC_UART0, UART_INTCFG_RLS, ENABLE);
00405         /*
00406          * Do not enable transmit interrupt here, since it is handled by
00407          * UART_Send() function, just to reset Tx Interrupt state for the
00408          * first time
00409          */
00410         TxIntStat = RESET;
00411 
00412         // Reset ring buf head and tail idx
00413         __BUF_RESET(rb.rx_head);
00414         __BUF_RESET(rb.rx_tail);
00415         __BUF_RESET(rb.tx_head);
00416         __BUF_RESET(rb.tx_tail);
00417 
00418     /* preemption = 1, sub-priority = 1 */
00419     NVIC_SetPriority(UART0_IRQn, ((0x01<<3)|0x01));
00420         /* Enable Interrupt for UART0 channel */
00421     NVIC_EnableIRQ(UART0_IRQn);
00422 
00423 
00424         // print welcome screen
00425         print_menu();
00426 
00427         // reset exit flag
00428         exitflag = RESET;
00429 
00430     /* Read some data from the buffer */
00431     while (exitflag == RESET)
00432     {
00433        len = 0;
00434         while (len == 0)
00435         {
00436             len = UARTReceive((LPC_UART_TypeDef *)LPC_UART0, buffer, sizeof(buffer));
00437         }
00438 
00439         /* Got some data */
00440         idx = 0;
00441         while (idx < len)
00442         {
00443             if (buffer[idx] == 27)
00444             {
00445                 /* ESC key, set exit flag */
00446                 UARTSend((LPC_UART_TypeDef *)LPC_UART0, menu3, sizeof(menu3));
00447                 exitflag = SET;
00448             }
00449             else if (buffer[idx] == 'r')
00450             {
00451                 print_menu();
00452             }
00453             else
00454             {
00455                 /* Echo it back */
00456                 UARTSend((LPC_UART_TypeDef *)LPC_UART0, &buffer[idx], 1);
00457             }
00458             idx++;
00459         }
00460     }
00461 
00462     // wait for current transmission complete - THR must be empty
00463     while (UART_CheckBusy((LPC_UART_TypeDef *)LPC_UART0));
00464 
00465     // DeInitialize UART0 peripheral
00466     UART_DeInit((LPC_UART_TypeDef *)LPC_UART0);
00467 
00468     /* Loop forever */
00469     while(1);
00470     return 1;
00471 }
00472 
00473 /* With ARM and GHS toolsets, the entry point is main() - this will
00474    allow the linker to generate wrapper code to setup stacks, allocate
00475    heap area, and initialize and copy code and data segments. For GNU
00476    toolsets, the entry point is through __start() in the crt0_gnu.asm
00477    file, and that startup code will setup stacks and data */
00478 int main(void)
00479 {
00480     return c_entry();
00481 }

00493         /* User can add his own implementation to report the file name and line number,
00494          ex: printf("Wrong parameters value: file %s on line %d\r\n", file, line) */
00495

00497         while(1);
00498 }
